docs.title: Welcome to geogee
docs.text:
A Python package for interactive mapping

  • Free software: MIT license
  • Documentation: https://geogee.gishub.org

docs.title: Credits
docs.text: This package was created with Cookiecutter and the geogee/pypackage project template.

docs.title: common Module
docs.text: The common module contains common functions and classes used by the other modules.

docs.title: hello_world()
docs.text:
Prints "Hello World!" to the console.

Source code in geogee\common.py 
def hello_world():
    """Prints "Hello World!" to the console.
    """
    print("Hello World!")

docs.title: Contributing
docs.text: Contributions are welcome! Please open an issue or submit a pull request.

docs.title: What is geogee?
docs.text: geogee is a Python package for geospatial analysis and visualization.

docs.title: Does it support Jupyter notebooks?
docs.text: Yes. This documentation is built with mkdocs-jupyter.

docs.title: Folium intro
docs.text:
In [ ]: Copied! 
# pip install folium
# pip install folium In [ ]: Copied! 
# conda install folium -c conda-forge
# conda install folium -c conda-forge In [ ]: Copied! 
import folium

m = folium.Map(location=(45.5236, -122.6750))
import folium m = folium.Map(location=(45.5236, -122.6750)) In [ ]: Copied! 
m
m In [ ]: Copied! 
m = folium.Map([45.35, -121.6972], zoom_start=12)

folium.Marker(
    location=[45.3288, -121.6625],
    tooltip="Click me!",
    popup="Mt. Hood Meadows",
    icon=folium.Icon(icon="cloud"),
).add_to(m)

folium.Marker(
    location=[45.3311, -121.7113],
    tooltip="Click me!",
    popup="Timberline Lodge",
    icon=folium.Icon(color="green"),
).add_to(m)

m
m = folium.Map([45.35, -121.6972], zoom_start=12) folium.Marker( location=[45.3288, -121.6625], tooltip="Click me!", popup="Mt. Hood Meadows", icon=folium.Icon(icon="cloud"), ).add_to(m) folium.Marker( location=[45.3311, -121.7113], tooltip="Click me!", popup="Timberline Lodge", icon=folium.Icon(color="green"), ).add_to(m) m

docs.title: Ipyleaflet intro
docs.text:
Getting Started with ipyleaflet

https://ipyleaflet.readthedocs.io

In [1]: Copied! 
import ipyleaflet
import ipyleaflet In [2]: Copied! 
m = ipyleaflet.Map()
m
m = ipyleaflet.Map() m Out[2]: 
Map(center=[0.0, 0.0], controls=(ZoomControl(options=['position', 'zoom_in_text', 'zoom_in_title', 'zoom_out_t…
In [3]: Copied! 
from ipyleaflet import Map, FullScreenControl, LayersControl, DrawControl, MeasureControl, ScaleControl
from ipyleaflet import Map, FullScreenControl, LayersControl, DrawControl, MeasureControl, ScaleControl In [24]: Copied! 
m = Map(center=[40, -100], zoom=4, scroll_wheel_zoom=True)
m.layout.height="700px"
m

from ipyleaflet import Map, Marker, MarkerCluster
from ipyleaflet import Map, Marker, MarkerCluster In [26]: Copied! 
marker1 = Marker(name='marker1', location=(50, -100))
marker2 = Marker(name='marker2', location=(30, -110))
marker3 = Marker(name='marker3', location=(40, -90))

marker_cluster = MarkerCluster(
    markers=(marker1, marker2, marker3), name="marker cluster"
)

m.add_layer(marker_cluster)
m
